turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Thaumaci.
turn.2: Thaumaci  Thaumaci or Thaumacus (), was a town and polis (city-state) of Phthiotis in Ancient Thessaly, was situated on the pass called Coela, on the road from Thermopylae and the Maliac Gulf passing through Lamia.
turn.3: Any interesting information from the article?
turn.4: The modern city of Domokos occupies its site.
turn.6: At this place, says Livy, the traveller, after traversing rugged mountains and intricate valleys, comes suddenly in sight of an immense plain like a vast sea, the extremity of which is scarcely visible.
turn.7: What was the most interesting aspect of this city?
turn.8: From the astonishment which it excited in the traveller, the city was supposed to have derived its name.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: It stood upon a lofty and precipitous rock.
turn.12: It was besieged by Philip V of Macedon in 199 BCE; but a reinforcement of Aetolians having made their way into the town, the king was obliged to abandon the siege.
